class_notes:
(Same as MESAS 190 2)
(Freshmen Seminar - Limited to First Year Students Only)
This course is a survey of the Modern Hebrew literary canon and its most significant achievements over three continents (Europe, North America, and Asia [Palestine and Israel]) and for the duration of the past 130 years. The readings include a selection of stories and poems (all in translation into English), by a range of authors from Mendele Mocher Sforim and Bialik to Yizhar and Ravikovitch. Class discussion veers to place each work in a historical and cultural context and aims to contribute to the development of academic reading and writing skills.
course_description: Designed to engage first-year students in aspects of inquiry and research into areas of Jewish religion, culture, history, or language. Topics will vary.
